bibl.title: Letter from Lytton G. Ament to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 10, 1929

div1.p: Ament is unable to assist Emilie Lawrence Reed at present, but expects to be able to soon.

div1.head: Letter from Lytton G. Ament to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 10, 1929
div1.opener:
LYTTON GRAY AMENT
15 CENTRAL PARK WEST
NEW YORK
May 10th, 1929.
My dear Mrs. Reed:-
div1.p:
Your letter received sometime ago.
I did not answer it due to the fact that I was not in
a position, nor am I in a position at the present time
to make any move along the lines that you suggest.

However, within the next thirty days
I expect to be in a position whereby I can be of
assistance to you and assure you that I shall be more
than happy to do anything I can for you and your daughter.

With kindest personal regards to you
and Blossom, I remain
div1.closer:
Most sincerely, LG Ament
LGA:B
Mrs. Walter Reed,
The Burlington Hotel,
Vermont Avenue at Thomas Circle,
Washington, D. C.
